core_sources.code.description: Generic decription of the code specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

core_sources.code.output_flag.description: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. {dynamic}

core_sources.code.parameters.description: List of the code specific parameters in XML format {constant}

core_sources.ids_properties.description: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

core_sources.ids_properties.comment.description: Any comment describing the content of this IDS {constant}

core_sources.ids_properties.homogeneous_.description: 1 if the time of this IDS is homogeneous. In this case, the time values for this IDS are stored in ../time just below the root of this IDS. Otherwise, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. {constant}

core_sources.source[:].identifier.index.description: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list) {constant}

core_sources.source[:].profiles_1d[:].description: Source profiles for various time slices {dynamic}

core_sources.source[:].profiles_1d[:].co.description: Parallel conductivity due to this source {dynamic} [ohm^-1.m^-1]
Index in the error_description list for "conductivity_parallel" {constant}

core_sources.source[:].profiles_1d[:].el.description: Source term for the electron energy equation {dynamic} [W.m^-3]
Index in the error_description list for "energy" {constant}
Source term for electron density equation {dynamic} [m^-3.s^-1]
Index in the error_description list for "particles" {constant}

core_sources.source[:].profiles_1d[:].gr.description: Cross-sectional area of the flux surface {dynamic} [m^2]
Index in the error_description list for "area" {constant}
Index in the error_description list for "psi" {constant}
Toroidal flux coordinate. rho_tor = sqrt(b_flux_tor/(pi*b0)) ~ sqrt(pi*r^2*b0/(pi*b0)) ~ r [m]. The toroidal field used in its definition is indicated under vacuum_toroidal_field/b0 {dynamic} [m]
Index in the error_description list for "rho_tor" {constant}

Normalised toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation, see time_slice/boundary/b_flux_pol_norm in the equilibrium IDS) {dynamic} [-]
Index in the error_description list for "rho_tor_norm" {constant}
Volume enclosed inside the magnetic surface {dynamic} [m^3]
Index in the error_description list for "volume" {constant}

core_sources.vacuum_toroidal_field.description: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in Rho_Tor definition and in the normalization of current densities)

core_sources.vacuum_toroidal_field.b0.description: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewed from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS. {dynamic} [T]

core_sources.vacuum_toroidal_field.b0_er.description: Index in the error_description list for "b0" {constant}

core_sources.vacuum_toroidal_field.r0.description: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane) {constant} [m]

core_sources.vacuum_toroidal_field.r0_er.description: Index in the error_description list for "r0" {constant}
